payload.name: apply_patch
payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: /Users/williamnguyen/.codex/config.toml
@@
 [mcp_servers.aws-terraform.env]
 FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL = "ERROR"
 
+# Billing and cost visibility tools for AWS usage
+[mcp_servers.billing-cost-management]
+command = "uvx"
+args = ["awslabs.billing-cost-management-mcp-server@latest"]
+startup_timeout_sec = 180
+[mcp_servers.billing-cost-management.env]
+FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL = "ERROR"
+AWS_PROFILE = "default"
+AWS_REGION = "us-east-1"
+
 # [mcp_servers.terraform-hashicorp]
 # command = "docker"
 # args = ["run", "-i", "--rm", "hashicorp/terraform-mcp-server"]
 # startup_timeout_sec = 120
 # tool_timeout_sec = 60
*** End Patch

payload.text: **Preparing to open search result by reference ID**

payload.message:
Pulled together the official Codex config reference and the latest AWS guidance so you can wire up the Billing & Cost Management MCP server (and a few other high-value servers) cleanly.

**Key Findings**
- Codex stores MCP launchers under `[mcp_servers.<name>]` in `~/.codex/config.toml`; each block sets the launch `command`, optional `args`, and an optional `[mcp_servers.<name>.env]` table for environment variables.([developers.openai.com](https://developers.openai.com/codex/mcp/?utm_source=openai))
- The `codex mcp` CLI subcommands (`add`, `list`, `get`, `remove`, `login`, `logout`) are the supported way to script changes if you’d rather not edit TOML by hand.([docs.onlinetool.cc](https://docs.onlinetool.cc/codex/docs/config.html?utm_source=openai))
- AWS currently maintains several MCP servers—`aws-diagram`, `terraform`, `billing-cost-management`, `cost-optimization-hub`, `aws-pricing`, `aws-documentation`, and more—each distributed as a `uvx`-launchable Python package with example env settings.([awslabs.github.io](https://awslabs.github.io/mcp/installation?utm_source=openai))
- The Billing & Cost Management server (released 22 Aug 2025) wraps Cost Explorer, Budgets, Cost Anomaly Detection, Compute Optimizer, and related APIs; it needs AWS credentials with those services enabled (Cost Explorer must be turned on) and works best when you set `AWS_PROFILE` and `AWS_REGION`.([aws.amazon.com](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2025/08/aws-billing-cost-management-mcp-server/?utm_source=openai))
- AWS’ reference config for Codex-compatible clients uses `uvx awslabs.billing-cost-management-mcp-server@latest`, `FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL=ERROR`, and your AWS profile/region; the same structure drops directly into Codex’s TOML.([awslabs.github.io](https://awslabs.github.io/mcp/servers/billing-cost-management-mcp-server?utm_source=openai))

````toml
[mcp_servers.billing-cost-management]
command = "uvx"
args = ["awslabs.billing-cost-management-mcp-server@latest"]
startup_timeout_sec = 180

[mcp_servers.billing-cost-management.env]
FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL = "ERROR"
AWS_PROFILE = "default"
AWS_REGION = "us-east-1"
````([developers.openai.com](https://developers.openai.com/codex/mcp/?utm_source=openai))

If you’d like more AWS-finance tooling, the `awslabs.aws-pricing-mcp-server` exposes live public pricing data (needs `pricing:*` IAM permissions) and uses the same `uvx` convention, while community servers such as `aws-cost-explorer-mcp-server` add Cost Explorer tooling via Docker.([awslabs.github.io](https://awslabs.github.io/mcp/servers/aws-pricing-mcp-server?utm_source=openai))

**Suggested Next Steps**
1. Decide whether to edit `~/.codex/config.toml` manually or run `codex mcp add billing-cost-management --env AWS_PROFILE=default --env AWS_REGION=us-east-1 -- uvx awslabs.billing-cost-management-mcp-server@latest` (adjust env vars as needed).([docs.onlinetool.cc](https://docs.onlinetool.cc/codex/docs/config.html?utm_source=openai))
2. After updating the config, run `codex mcp list` to confirm the server is detected, then start Codex and watch for the server to initialize (enable Cost Explorer first if you haven’t already).([docs.onlinetool.cc](https://docs.onlinetool.cc/codex/docs/config.html?utm_source=openai))

summary.text: **Preparing to open search result by reference ID**

content.text:
Pulled together the official Codex config reference and the latest AWS guidance so you can wire up the Billing & Cost Management MCP server (and a few other high-value servers) cleanly.

**Key Findings**
- Codex stores MCP launchers under `[mcp_servers.<name>]` in `~/.codex/config.toml`; each block sets the launch `command`, optional `args`, and an optional `[mcp_servers.<name>.env]` table for environment variables.([developers.openai.com](https://developers.openai.com/codex/mcp/?utm_source=openai))
- The `codex mcp` CLI subcommands (`add`, `list`, `get`, `remove`, `login`, `logout`) are the supported way to script changes if you’d rather not edit TOML by hand.([docs.onlinetool.cc](https://docs.onlinetool.cc/codex/docs/config.html?utm_source=openai))
- AWS currently maintains several MCP servers—`aws-diagram`, `terraform`, `billing-cost-management`, `cost-optimization-hub`, `aws-pricing`, `aws-documentation`, and more—each distributed as a `uvx`-launchable Python package with example env settings.([awslabs.github.io](https://awslabs.github.io/mcp/installation?utm_source=openai))
- The Billing & Cost Management server (released 22 Aug 2025) wraps Cost Explorer, Budgets, Cost Anomaly Detection, Compute Optimizer, and related APIs; it needs AWS credentials with those services enabled (Cost Explorer must be turned on) and works best when you set `AWS_PROFILE` and `AWS_REGION`.([aws.amazon.com](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2025/08/aws-billing-cost-management-mcp-server/?utm_source=openai))
- AWS’ reference config for Codex-compatible clients uses `uvx awslabs.billing-cost-management-mcp-server@latest`, `FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL=ERROR`, and your AWS profile/region; the same structure drops directly into Codex’s TOML.([awslabs.github.io](https://awslabs.github.io/mcp/servers/billing-cost-management-mcp-server?utm_source=openai))

````toml
[mcp_servers.billing-cost-management]
command = "uvx"
args = ["awslabs.billing-cost-management-mcp-server@latest"]
startup_timeout_sec = 180

[mcp_servers.billing-cost-management.env]
FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL = "ERROR"
AWS_PROFILE = "default"
AWS_REGION = "us-east-1"
````([developers.openai.com](https://developers.openai.com/codex/mcp/?utm_source=openai))

If you’d like more AWS-finance tooling, the `awslabs.aws-pricing-mcp-server` exposes live public pricing data (needs `pricing:*` IAM permissions) and uses the same `uvx` convention, while community servers such as `aws-cost-explorer-mcp-server` add Cost Explorer tooling via Docker.([awslabs.github.io](https://awslabs.github.io/mcp/servers/aws-pricing-mcp-server?utm_source=openai))

**Suggested Next Steps**
1. Decide whether to edit `~/.codex/config.toml` manually or run `codex mcp add billing-cost-management --env AWS_PROFILE=default --env AWS_REGION=us-east-1 -- uvx awslabs.billing-cost-management-mcp-server@latest` (adjust env vars as needed).([docs.onlinetool.cc](https://docs.onlinetool.cc/codex/docs/config.html?utm_source=openai))
2. After updating the config, run `codex mcp list` to confirm the server is detected, then start Codex and watch for the server to initialize (enable Cost Explorer first if you haven’t already).([docs.onlinetool.cc](https://docs.onlinetool.cc/codex/docs/config.html?utm_source=openai))
So the AWS_PROFILE is default, and the region should be ap-southeast-2

payload.message: So the AWS_PROFILE is default, and the region should be ap-southeast-2

Great—just swap in those values when you add the server:

```
[mcp_servers.billing-cost-management]
command = "uvx"
args = ["awslabs.billing-cost-management-mcp-server@latest"]
startup_timeout_sec = 180

[mcp_servers.billing-cost-management.env]
FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL = "ERROR"
AWS_PROFILE = "default"
AWS_REGION = "ap-southeast-2"
```

If you prefer the CLI helper instead of editing the file directly, this does the same thing:

`codex mcp add billing-cost-management --env FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL=ERROR --env AWS_PROFILE=default --env AWS_REGION=ap-southeast-2 -- uvx awslabs.billing-cost-management-mcp-server@latest`

Either way you’re set for the default profile in Sydney.
